text:
hey <@U7SL518D6> -- I'm getting an error I've not seen before and I'm not exactly sure how to resolve this instance.

on `npx hs watch` I'm getting an error saying

```[ERROR] Another custom widget with id <Widget-ID> already exists with the label footer in folder with id <Folder-ID> in portal <Portal-ID>```
This item hasn't changed, but we have been working in a multi-dev environment and passing files back and forth via github
the other change that has occurred is a parent folder name change

I could see that parent folder name change potentially causing this. Because if you rename it locally. and it gets uploaded I think it wouldn’t understand you renamed it, it would try uploading that as a new folder.

Try renaming the folder in the design manager and see if that solves it.

What are your thoughts on resolving this? In this instance, because the site isn't live and is still in dev, it is possible to rename the module folder, but in a future instance where the build is live or even further along, that would potentially be a big deal, as you would be completely replacing the instance of the module.
You are meaning the specific module folder in this instance, correct?

I could see this potentially happening with any folder being renamed via the CLI because to the CLI I think it just sees it as a new folder, and the old folder is potentially deleted. I will ask internally, this is a good question.

Over-all though I thinkas long as you have downloaded the module’s meta info, it should understand in the design manager that it’s the same module and not potentially break dependents. Again I will check.
can you DM me a link to the module that you saw this issues with, it’d also be good if you can send me the meta.json file you have locally too
Checking on a couple things... renaming some of the folders made it a bit odd and I'm trying to see if I can re-create it
There were some odd pathing things that got.... strange
hm. Haven't been able to recreate it
so....uh.... I'll let you know if it happens again? :shrug:
okay. Yea let us know. We want to make sure  that works as expected.
